abstract: Since Citigroup‘s split with former wealth-management head Todd S. Thomson, much of the reporting has focused on his supposedly lavish ways and his ties to a CNBC anchor. But a story in BusinessWeek suggests that some on Wall Street think Mr. Thomson became a convenient scapegoat for Citigroup and that his ouster was a way to distract from deeper problems.
